description: Minimal episode fixture for tests. Contains fields needed for interlude, scoreboard, FT detection.

segments.text: Welcome to Match of the Dead.
Seven games, plenty of goals and a couple of horror shows.
Alan Shearer and Ashley Williams join us.
It's a day late, but is that a trick or a treat?
I'll let you at home decide.
It was six defeats in seven in all competitions
for champions Liverpool.
Aston Villa had just won their last four in the league.
Your commentator at Anfield, Steve Wilson.
Only once in the last 70 years
have Liverpool suffered such a dismal run of results.
Informed Villa might be feeling that this represents an opportunity
to beat them for the first time since that 7-2 game of 2020.
Ignore the Carabao Cup, after all, Arnaud Slot did.
There are two changes to the Liverpool XI
beaten by Brentford last weekend,
Kierkegaard and Virts,
replaced by Robertson and fit again, Dravenberg.
Villa, who've won their last four,
the longest current winning streak in the Premier League,
make one change,
Evan Guesson for the injured Emiliano Buendia.
Can Liverpool get a league victory on the board
after a dismal period?
Watkins.
Rodgers trying to give Watkins options.
Here he is, Morgan Rodgers.
Lots of white shirts.
Forward and he's hit the post.
Well, Morgan Rodgers scored a fine goal
at Tottenham Hotspur the other week.
There's a little deflection on that,
and it carried it beyond Mamedashvili.
In 2024, the calendar year,
excluding penalty shootouts,
he lost one game.
In 2025, excluding shootouts.
So far, he's lost 14.
Gakpo into Dominic Soboslai.
It wasn't far away.
Decent hit, but always heading wide,
as you can see from that angle,
and Martínez never looked worried.
Salah's got the better of Lucardin here,
and he's inside of Onana,
and he's looking for Gakpo,
and his header nearly found Eketike.
Pretty certain Cody Gakpo was trying to get that on target,
but it actually very nearly landed
on the header of Hugo Eketike.
Gakpo for Soboslai.
Robertson, deflected,
and kindly for Villa.
Rodgers.
A camera into Cash.
Villa have broken quickly and in numbers.
Cash.
Goodness me.
He is so close.
This is a brilliant effort.
And make no mistake about it,
he meant it all right.
Georgi Marmadashvili's got a finger on this.
It took a deflection, too.
And that's twice now Villa have hit the woodwork.
Rodgers.
There's a gap, and he's going through it,
and he's hit it well,
and Marmadashvili pushed it out.
Good run by Rodgers.
Good hit, too, though.
Marmadashvili would expect to save those all day long, really.
Basically surrendered the Carabao Cup in midweek,
which some might understand, some didn't.
Tau Torres.
Line has been nicked by Soboslai.
Dominic Soboslai hits tamely into Emiliano Martinez.
He had Eketike to his left, Salah to his right.
And Villa are very lucky to get away with this.
They're actually unbeaten in six now, Villa.
They haven't lost a league game since August.
Ryan Gravenberg.
Salah.
Looking for Gravenberg.
It's come to McAllister.
Great block by Konsa.
Really good defending that.
Luka Dins lost his bearings here a little bit.
Soboslai.
Eketike!
If he's onside, there'll be a check.
Oh, he's offside. That's not going to count.
Quite surprising that the flag didn't go up, in all honesty,
because he's that far offside.
His face suggested.
He suggested that the celebrations were going to be cut short.
And that is the case.
What's he done?
Emilio Martinez.
Mohamed Salah rolls in his 250th Liverpool goal.
And it was wrapped up with a silk bow and presented to him.
Liverpool in front.
And in a time when they desperately needed a bit of luck
or an absolute gift.
They got the latter.
Give Salah a bit of credit.
He still actually finished it quite nicely,
putting it to the left of Pau Torres.
Villa have hit the woodwork twice,
but gifted Liverpool the lead.
Such is Liverpool's propensity to concede goals
that it's very unlikely that they will feel comfortable at 1-0.
They might not feel comfortable at 2-0.
Van Dijk directing it to Gatpoe.
McAllister into Gravenberg.
Here's an opportunity.
Gravenberg!
They've missed him, Ryan Gravenberg, with that ankle injury.
But he's back in the side and back in the goals.
And Liverpool have a cushion now.
And it's a big deflection off the sliding Pau Torres,
which actually diverted it away from Martinez.
A little bit unfortunate, Villa here.
But it's Liverpool 2-0 Villa.
Feels like the next goal in this game could be very important
if Liverpool were to score it, then you'd think job done.
If Villa get it, then a very different story.
Oh, deflected into the path of Dominic Sobislai.
This could finish it here, Mohamed Salah.
Oh, it's blocked.
Rebounding to Sobislai, who's in an offside position.
That was a real opportunity for Liverpool, again from Villa error.
Pass from Sobislai, had it been onto Salah's right boot,
just might have made it more favourable for him.
Emery bored?
Never, but it was every minute.
Ryan Gravenberg, blocked by Esri Konca, straight into the path of advancing Villa.
Barkley into Daniel Marlin as the subs combine,
and Marlin puts that just wide.
Started by Konca, continued by Barkley.
And dipping wide from Marlin.
Well, that's nicely worked to catch.
Watkins in the middle, Rodgers in the middle.
Blocked by Van Dijk, Villa corner.
It was a glimmer, that.
And with 20 minutes to go, if Villa can get one,
they will firmly believe that they have time to get another one
in a crowded goalmouth tonight.
Alexis McAllister.
Onana shoving McAllister here around the neck,
which is ill-advised.
It's a yellow card for Amadou Onana.
Nudge McAllister over again.
And the referee has said, leave it out.
Finally in comes the corner kick into the crowd.
Referee has blown his whistle and given the free kick to Liverpool.
McAllister and Onana three times involved in the tussle.
The decision celebrated by Liverpool's World Cup winner.
One or two Villa fans now beginning to drift away.
The M6 isn't that far away,
but it can take a long time to get there from here after a match.
Emery is a bit annoyed with Dominic Soboslai,
as he thinks they are not getting on with it.
And Soboslai has indeed been shown a yellow card.
And so too has Unai Emery.
Margins are small every single game,
so again today after five minutes they hit the post.
Maybe we didn't concede a set-piece, which is helpful as well.
And maybe we were now a little bit lucky.
Good first goal, although they made a mistake of course.
But it wasn't the first time that we were able to be dangerous after a high press.
And second goal deflection is a bit of luck,
which we haven't had a lot of the last few weeks.
The second half we started not with the first half we did.
And then we were trying to change something.
They scored the second goal and after it was more difficult.
But how we compete, how we play,
how we play overall, building the team like we are,
we had to accept this defeat and try to keep going
and looking forward for the next matches.
So Liverpool back to winning ways, Ashley.
But even Arne Slot had talked of late about the blueprint to beat his team.
But Villa went away from that today.
Yeah, in recent weeks Liverpool have showed a vulnerability
in dealing with long balls straight down the middle.
And as you said, Arne Slot has mentioned that.
In recent weeks.
But we know Unai Emery is very, you know, tactically he's normally sound.
But I was confused about the way he set his team up today
with the tactics that they were playing,
especially from the goalkeeper.
They had numerous chances to play the ball into the position
we were just talking about where Liverpool struggled.
But they seemed obsessed with playing the short pass.
And Liverpool were very front footed today.
And this is early on in the game.
They get away with that one.
Here's another chance to play the ball.
But long because it's Ollie Watkins,
who's good at holding the ball up.
That's not long enough.
Robertson wins it.
Ends up with a chance again.
They get away with it again.
And it was every single time with Martinez.
Paul Torres can play the same ball from this position.
He turns that down.
They want to build up through midfield.
But it's slow.
It's sluggish.
It's not sharp enough.
He doesn't get turned.
Now they've got themselves into trouble again.
That should have been a goal.
So they've had lots and lots of warnings.
Torres is on the ball again
with no pressure.
If you've got Ollie Watkins up front,
hit him or put it in behind
and make the defenders run back to their own goal
and deal with it.
This is what I mean about the sloppy play.
So not only have they not gone long,
they're passing it.
And it's so inaccurate and sloppy.
And Mo Salah will never score an easier goal than that
in his career.
So it was just confusing really.
We've got the graph up here,
the stats,
and they've played the fewest long balls
against Liverpool this season.
And when it's so obvious that they've been vulnerable,
it was confusing that Unai Emery
or the Aston Villa players
decided to play short out from the back.
That was Mo Salah's 250th goal,
putting third on the all-time list for Liverpool.
Generally, Ashley said they're front-footed.
They were more physical, more combative,
and more energy.
Definitely.
Liverpool, it wasn't perfect,
but it was a lot better.
And they just had to win the game tonight.
But I thought the Gravenberg back in midfield
gave them a bit more energy,
a bit more stability,
and certainly a bit more organisation.
And there's no doubt
they deserved to win the game.
I thought they played well.
They pressed there.
They win the ball back there.
And you can see that they're all in really good positions,
ready to hit Aston Villa again.
And that's what they did.
They said on a slot,
they got the little bit of luck
that perhaps they haven't had
with a little deflection.
But you can see from the angle there,
the way they set up,
they know exactly what they want Aston Villa to do,
and they're forcing them to do that.
And we're really happy that they did that
because, as I said,
they were ready for them
and they were organised.
This wasn't happening last week.
You've seen the performance.
And again, because of what the team
that they put out with midweek,
they somehow just had to win the game today.
They've got to get the belief back,
a little bit of confidence back,
and that will do them the world of good.
It was the right result.
It's what they needed.
And as I said, there's the stats there.
Have a look at the stats.
The duels won, the tackles,
all of those things
where they were criticised for last weekend
for not doing.
This weekend, this game,
it was back to something
that we've been used to with this Liverpool team.
So hopefully for them from now on,
that will be the start of their form back again.
Thank you very much.
Leaders, Arsenal didn't concede a goal in October,
winning six matches in all competitions.
Back-to-back victories for Burnley
had moved them clear of the bottom three.
Stephen Wyeth was at Turf Moor.
A shared satisfaction at even healthier positions
than they may have aspired to.
Burnley are six points better off
than at this stage of their last visit to the top flight,
but change the side they're on.
They've won them those successive games.
Josh Laurent replaces Jakub Brun Larsson
as Scott Parker opts to beef things up defensively.
After ten changes in the League Cup in midweek,
Arsenal revert to the team
that made it four Premier League wins in a row.
That means William Saliba's overcome an ankle injury.
Leandro Trossard makes his 100th league appearance
for the Gunners.
Both sets of players wearing black armbands this afternoon
in memory of a pair of former Gunners
Willie Young and Colin Addison.
Young formed a formidable defensive partnership
alongside that man David O'Leary.
Only Premier League champions Liverpool
have come to Turf Moor and left with a league victory
in the last 18 months.
And current Premier League leaders
looking to do something about that today.

aiming for Jokeres.

have their first of the afternoon.
In from Declan Rice.
Deep with it.
Confusion.

for the Premier League leaders.

for Jokeres to pounce on the loose ball.

in a 5-0 win.

Trossard.
For Rice.

From one end of the field to the other.
To put themselves 2-0 in front.
And how's that for a goal from open play?
A devastating counter-attack.
Jokeres.

And the one that arrived in the perfect area.
Declan Rice.
And the team that sits at the top of the table now have a margin that better reflects their first half dominant.

To Nsebe.
Towards Esteve.
Chance here for Burnley.

And Arsenal are going to start November as they navigated their season.
They're way through October with a victory.

To prevent Christian Norgard getting a first Arsenal goal.

Making sure they have done enough.

In from Rice.
That's again Burnley uncertain.

And they're looking to create something for themselves.
Bruun Larsson.

The player who took the corner, Declan Rice.
Hannibal.

The final act of the game.

And Arsenal start November as they serenely progressed through October with a win.
And no goal conceded.
At first, we were exceptional.
Scored two goals.
Probably should have scored another two or three.
We gave nothing away.
And that was a platform to win it.
Because in the second half, it's true that we weren't that precise.
Especially with the ball.
We had to make a few changes.
And yeah, we didn't have that much control of the game.
But defensively, again, we were exceptional to maintain the clean sheet.
We'll take massive positives from that second half.
It's like we have throughout this season when we've played against top, top teams.
There's been elements that we need to improve on.
And certain elements which are really encouraging.
And that was his second half here today.
And Declan Rice.
He was everywhere today.
It was a game of a real leader, it seemed.
Absolutely.
I think he stepped up.
And when it came in the most, he won I don't know how many balls, how many tackles.
He carried the ball.
He scored the goal.
So, yeah, that's his evolution as a player.
Longest winning run since 2018 with ten victories.
Seven clean sheets.
You know, we heap the praise on Arsenal week after week in terms of their attack.
And we talk about their set pieces.
But you're going to look at their attack today through a different prism.
Yeah, we've analysed Declan Rice this week.
He was outstanding again today.
We've looked at Jokeres.
Obviously defensively, we've looked at them.
And they're rock solid.
But perhaps what we might not have seen so much are how such an important role is played by the two full-backs.
Timber and Calafiori.
I mean, their stats really are off the charts.
And it would be easy to say, well, okay, because they dominated for large periods today.
Particularly in the first half.
This is not today.
This is all season.
Look at the stats for total shots.
Calafiori's season.
Second expected goals.
Touches in the opposition box.
They're so high up there, particularly compared to their forward players.
And today was another great example of what a great strength it is to have them both.
I mean, look at Calafiori here.
He's in a centre-forward position.
He's further forward than anyone else.
And all right, he doesn't get the ball to begin with.
But look what happens with that run.
That then gets the corner, which Arsenal once again score from.
Great delivery.
The knockback is superb.
And Jokeres is in there to tap it away.
Same thing again.
He gets into a really good forward position.
That run is the run of a centre-forward.
And again, they get another set piece, which we know how dangerous they are.
This he works really well.
Not really involved until he gets into the box.
But just watch his final position and where he actually ends up.
Again, he's in that centre-forward position.
Very difficult to pick up.
Eventually the ball gets in.
He could get his shot away a little bit earlier, but he does eventually.
And again, they get another set piece.
But it's all because of him and his willingness to get forward.
Second half, all right, we looked at Calafiori in the first half.
Uri and Timber did exactly the same on the other side in the second half.
They are such a threat and so difficult to pick up.
Now watch his run into the centre-forward position.
The ball goes in.
It's a great ball.
And he's really, really unlucky he's not on the end of it.
But his intention is to get in there.
He's got a great relationship with Saka.
They're down that right-hand side.
They understand each other.
They know when and where to pass it.
But again, he's in that position, getting forward.
And there's Calafiori coming onto the edge of the box.
So something that we maybe not have picked out before,
but it's something very different.
And those two players give great options for Arsenal in those forward positions
and have done all season.
Alan mentioned Declan Rice.
His manager today mentioned him as well, gave him special praise.
And you're also going to heap some attention onto him
because today was another complete performance.
He was excellent today.
I thought he covered every blade of grass.
Look at these stats from the game today.
He ranks first in touches, passes played into the box, total crosses.
I like this one because he's such a good ball carrier,
the total distance of ball carrying.
As a centre-back myself, he would be perfect if he's in front of you
because he does all of the work that you don't really see.
He picks up second balls.
His set-piece delivery is so important to what Arsenal do.
They score so many goals from that.
He also chips in with goals like he did today.
It's not an understatement to say at the minute he's a complete midfielder.
He can attack and defend.
I think he's so integral to what Arsenal are trying to do.
He embodies everything that the manager's built the team around.
Outstanding.
OK.
It is a year today since Ruben Amaran took charge at Manchester United.

tributes paid to Colin Addison and Willie Young,
